alert.note: Alert for Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 9:40PM EST until February 08 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Vincennes. .Lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton, and will arrive at Vincennes Tuesday night. The crest is currently at Montezuma. Flooding is expected to continue along the lower Wabash at Riverton and Vincennes well into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 08... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to Thursday, February 08. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural lands and some oil fields flood. Several township roads about 1.25 miles south of St. Francesville and River Road between Billett Road and Lincoln Memorial Bridge in Lawrence County are flooded. Extensive flooding of Kimmell Park at Vincennes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Monday /7:45 PM CST Monday/ the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday morning to a crest of 18.3 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, February 07. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Tuesday afternoon by around 1245 PM EST /1145 AM CST/.
